name: Miro
description:
What is it?

Miro is an online whiteboard tool. It has numerous tempaltes and integrations that allow you to run most team activities/ceremonies.

Why here?

At Red Badger, Miro is our default collaboration tool and suitable for most of our use cases.

Notes

https://miro.com/

name: Slack Huddles
description:
What is it?

A new feature for Slack which allows you to quickly enter audio only calls with your teamates.

Why here?

Huddles are still a relatively new feature and some people will prefer other forms of communication, but huddles seem to be preferable to Slack calls. Huddles are suitable for quick informal chats thata re more ad-hoc

Notes

https://slack.com/intl/en-gb/help/articles/4402059015315-Use-huddles-in-Slack

name: Figjam
description:
What is it?

An addition to Figma, FigJam is similar to Miro and comes with templates for Standups, Team Boards and other agile ceremonies.

Why here?

FigJam doesn't appear to be as well adopted as other whiteboarding tools, but it has the benefit of integrating with Figma, allowing you to link elements in your whoteboards to designs & prototypes.

Notes

https://www.figma.com/figjam/

name: Around
description:
What is it?

Around is a video call client specifically made to support hybrid working/

Why here?

Around is becoming more popular. It has different layout options to allow you to be visible on a call whilst still working (floating chat windows). It also has several games and features to enhance collaboration.

Notes

https://www.around.co/

name: Cron
description:
What is it?

A calendar app for managing multiple shared calendars in one place

Why here?

One issue we face is managing multiple team/client calendars. Cron allows to view all your calendars in one place and help you schedule new meetings.

Notes

Only works with Google Calendars currently, signup via waitlist https://cron.com/

name: Loom
description:
What is it?

Loom lets you quickly record short emssages from your webcam and your screen and send to teammates

Why here?

When you need to demo something to someone but are working remotely, you can't just go tot heir desk and see it. Loom let's you quickly demo something and send the recording via a shareable link. It emans you don't have to go to the trouble of setting up a fresh zoom or hangout.

Notes

https://www.loom.com/

name: Google Meet Integration for Miro
description:
What is it?

This is a new integration that let's you start a Google Meet over your Miro board.

Why here?

Similar to Around, this is good for people using one screen/laptops where screen real-estate is limited. There's a ot of overhead in setting it up involving SSO which makes it less desirable to use. As it's a new-ish integration, there's potential for it if to improve based on user feedback.

Notes

https://miro.com/blog/google-meet/

name: Google Drive
description:
What is it?

Google Drive, part of GSuite tools, document storage, integrates with Google Docs, Sheets, Forms etc

Why here?

We're always debating what should be stored in Google Drive vs a wiki type tool like Slite

Notes

https://www.google.co.uk/intl/en-GB/drive/

name: Slite
description:
What is it?

Slite is a wiki type tool

Why here?

We use it a lot for documenting practices, meeting notes, useful resources. It's in assess as we often can't decide wether we should be using Slite or google Docs.

Notes

slite.com

name: Slack Calls
description:
What is it?

Built into Slack, Slack Calls allow for AV calls through Slack

Why here?

There are simply better tools for video conferencing that also allow for better collaboration

Notes

slack.com

name: In-Person days
description:
What is it?

Have one day each week/month, where everyone works in-person.

Why here?

  • Helps with organising team ceremonies or essential workshops
  • Gives team a chance to socialise
  • Requires access to a dedicated physical space
  • Harder for teams that are more dispersed, further away from each other

name: Regular time for Socialising/Fun
description:
What is it?

Blocking out a regular timeslot for the team to do a fun activity/game

Why here?

  • Helps with morale & well-being
  • Good for team bonding
  • Can be done remotely or in-person
  • Lots of options for what to do

name: Meeting Free Mornings
description:
What is it?

Blocking out one morning a week where no meetings can be scheduled

Why here?

  • Gives everyone time to focus on what they need to focus on
  • Prevents potential zoom fatigue
  • Will inevitably be subject to any emergency/last-minute calls
  • Can be a challenge in getting clients on board with the idea

name: Icebreakers/Energisers
description:
What is it?

Starting a meeting with an icebreaker or energiser activity

Why here?

  • Eases people in to potentially challenging meetings
  • Can be tailored to suit the theme of the meeting
  • Some clients will struggle to see the benefit "Let's just get to the important stuff"

name: Focus Time
description:
What is it?

Blocking out time to focus on project work with no interruptions

Why here?

  • https://reclaim.ai/blog/what-is-focus-time
  • Encourages people to prioritise their work, single task-focus
  • Gets you into "deep work" mode
  • Interruptions can still happen
  • Not as effective if no focus is set
  • In some work environments, blocking out a few hours for yourself won't be realistic

name: Weekly Reports
description:
What is it?

Producing a weekly report on the team's progress for stakeholders

Why here?

  • Good chance they aren't getting read, unless there's a feedback mechanism
  • Can be time consuming
  • Does encourage you to make time to review team progress/ways of working

name: Slack Calls
description:
What is it?

Using Slack for team video calls

Why here?

  • If a video call is required, there are better clients for that
  • Can be buggy, prone to mic/camera issues

name: Audit Regular Team Meetings
description:
What is it?

Regularly auditing the team's regular meetings

Why here?

  • Encourages you to think about what value you're getting from meetings, set an intention/goal for each one
  • Bin meetings that aren't working anymore

name: Response Time Expectations
description:
What is it?

Set explicit SLAs for when people can expect responses

Why here?

  • Sets expectations early
  • Can be a challenge to agree to a timeframe that works for all

name: Set Client Expectations for Hybrid Working
description:
What is it?

Creating a Hybrid Working code of conduct with client

Why here?

  • Manages client expectations early
  • Expectations are documented should expectations not be met
  • Will likely be some compromise involved

name: Maintaining Routines
description:
What is it?

It can be a challenge to maintain a normal routine when remote working, esepcially if you're working across multiple time-zones. Finding the right times to schedule agile ceremonies can be difficult.

name: Tooling
description:
What is it?

Finding the right tooling can be a challenge even for co-located teams. With tooling aimed to aid remote working, the challenge is to find tools the whole team find easy-to-use and do what is required.

name: Workshop Participation & Facilitation
description:
What is it?

As Agile Leads, faciliatation is a big part of our job. Remote working means we have to put extra time into planning workshops and think about how we can collaborate and have active particpation in them.
